alert.note: Alert for Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 09 at 3:47PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Washita and southeastern Custer Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 347 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Corn, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Corn and Colony. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
